articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: U.S. jobless claims edge lower but trend points to uptick in filings
articles.description: The number of Americans filing claims for jobless benefits edged lower last week, a positive signal for the U.S. labor market amid recent signs that new claims may be trending slightly higher.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The number of Americans filing claims for jobless benefits edged lower last week, a positive signal for the U.S. labor market amid recent signs that new claims may be trending slightly higher.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Israel's Canndoc signs cannabis import-export deal with Tilray
articles.description: Israel's InterCure Ltd said on Thursday its subsidiary Canndoc has signed a strategic cooperation agreement with Tilray Inc for the import and export of medical cannabis.
articles.content:
TEL AVIV (Reuters) - Israel’s InterCure Ltd said on Thursday its subsidiary Canndoc has signed a strategic cooperation agreement with Tilray Inc for the import and export of medical cannabis. 
Canndoc has an option to import 2.5 tons of high quality cannabis… [+1108 chars]

articles.author: Ginger Gibson
articles.title: Popular Iowa congresswoman endorses Joe Biden for president
articles.description: A popular Democratic congresswoman from Iowa endorsed former Vice President Joe Biden's presidential bid on Thursday, a move that could help him gain backing in the state weeks before voters there hold the first nominating contest.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A popular Democratic congresswoman from Iowa endorsed former Vice President Joe Biden’s presidential bid on Thursday, a move that could help him gain backing in the state weeks before voters there hold the first nominating contest.

articles.author: Huw Jones
articles.title: EuroCCP says needs 1.5 billion euro loan to fix "weakness"
articles.description: Clearing house EuroCCP said it needs a 1.5 billion euro ($1.68 billion) loan to fix "liquidity weaknesses" identified by regulators.
articles.content:
LONDON (Reuters) - Clearing house EuroCCP said it needs a 1.5 billion euro ($1.68 billion) loan to fix “liquidity weaknesses” identified by regulators. 
Cboe, the largest pan-European stock market, said on Dec. 10 it had agreed to acquire the remaining 80% o… [+1926 chars]

articles.author: Abdi Sheikh
articles.title: New Year brings hope, grief to Somali family devastated by bomb blast
articles.description: As wounded men screaming for their mothers were brought into a Mogadishu hospital after a huge truck bomb on Saturday, doctors fought to save eight month-old Mohammed Hassan, whose mother was already dead.
articles.content:
MOGADISHU (Reuters) - As wounded men screaming for their mothers were brought into a Mogadishu hospital after a huge truck bomb on Saturday, doctors fought to save eight month-old Mohammed Hassan, whose mother was already dead.

articles.title: Nigerian teen in pink aims to 'take the golf world by storm'
articles.description: A steady "thwack" rings out at the driving range just outside Nigeria's capital Abuja. A girl clad in pink shoes, pink skirt and pink vest wields a club with a power that belies her slight frame, grimacing at poor shots and smiling happily at others.

articles.title: Uber Eats goes local to find its niche in South African food fight
articles.description: A stone's throw from Nelson Mandela's former home in South Africa's Soweto township, Dumile Badela's restaurant is now more hectic and lucrative than ever, thanks to Uber Eats, his hungriest customer yet.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Lappi joins M-Sport Ford after Citroen exit
articles.description: Finnish driver Esapekka Lappi will race for the M-Sport Ford team in this year's world rally championship after previous employers Citroen withdrew at the end of last season.
articles.content:
LONDON (Reuters) - Finnish driver Esapekka Lappi will race for the M-Sport Ford team in this year’s world rally championship after previous employers Citroen withdrew at the end of last season.

articles.title: WEEKAHEAD-AFRICA-FX-Kenyan shilling seen rising, Zambia's kwacha under pressure
articles.description: Kenya's shilling is expected to strengthen in the coming week, while the Tanzanian and Ugandan currencies are seen stable and Zambia's kwacha is likely to remain under pressure, currency traders told Reuters.
articles.content:
KAMPALA, Jan 2 (Reuters) - Kenya’s shilling is expected to strengthen in the coming week, while the Tanzanian and Ugandan currencies are seen stable and Zambia’s kwacha is likely to remain under pressure, currency traders told Reuters.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Turkey to back Libya deployment bill but troops unlikely for now
articles.description: Turkish lawmakers are set to back a bill on Thursday that allows troop deployment in Tripoli, but that is likely to begin with military support, training and drones in the air rather than boots on the ground.
articles.content:

articles.title: Turkey may send allied Syrian fighters to Libya - sources
articles.description: Turkey is considering sending allied Syrian fighters to Libya as part of planned military support for the besieged government in Tripoli, senior Turkish sources said on Monday, potentially bringing more foreign influence into the complex conflict.
